meanings.definition: An evil spirit or being, often associated with Hell and temptation.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was scared of the devil in her nightmare.
meanings.sent2: The villagers believed the devil lurked in the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, the mischievous devil in her laughed.
meanings.sent4: His addiction to gambling was like making a deal with the devil.
meanings.sent5: The devil whispered sinful thoughts into his mind.

meanings.sent1: The criminal was known as the neighborhood devil.
meanings.sent2: The devil in human form plotted to steal the crown jewels.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous devil of a brother hid her favorite toy as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was a real devil, always making her work late.
meanings.sent5: The devil's smile sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.sent1: The little boy was a little devil, always pulling pranks.
meanings.sent2: The devil of a friend convinced her to skip class and go on an adventure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous devil of a puppy chewed up her favorite shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like music, a playful devil dancing in the air.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous devil winked before disappearing into the crowd.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Oh, devil! I forgot my keys inside the house again.
meanings.sent2: Devil take this traffic! I'm going to be late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Well, devil! Looks like I burned the dinner once more.
meanings.sent4: The devil with this broken phone! It never works when I need it.
meanings.sent5: Devil! Why does it always rain on the day of my picnic?
